item.title: Jace add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There are those who scoff at the schoolboy, calling him frivolous and shallow: Yet it was the schoolboy who said 'Faith is believing what you know ain't so'." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jace add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "Men travel faster now, but I do not know if they go to better things." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Jace add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jace add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr
item.description: "Dear future generations: Please accept our apologies. We were rolling drunk on petroleum." -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr

item.title: Jace add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jace add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "The past is never dead. It's not even past." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Jace add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Indianapolis, Indiana is the first place in the United States of America where a white man was hanged for the murder of an Indian. The kind of people who'll hang a white man for murdering an Indian--that's the kind of people for me." -- Kurt Vonnegut
